document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Bark Beetle Genera Within the Former Cryphalini (Curculionidae: Scolytinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus artocarpus Schedl, 1958d: 498
(syn: Schedl, 1975d). =

(unnecessary replacement name).

].

.

(

).

.

=

(syn: Schedl, 1958e ). =

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cryphalusdiscretus Eichhoff,1878a: 385 comb. res. [
Hypocryphalus
]. =
Cryphalus discretus Eichhoff, 1878b: 490
(syn:
Johnson et al., 2017
).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus scabricollis Eichhoff, 1878b: 491
(syn: Wood, 1989 ). =
Cryphalus brevisetosus Schedl, 1943: 36
(syn: Wood, 1989 ).

=
Hylesinus sericeus Motschulsky, 1866: 402
(syn: Wood, 1969 ). =
Hypoborus nebulosus Motschulsky, 1866: 403
(syn: Wood, 1969 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: No formal synonymy has been proposed for this species name. Wood (1969) indicated that they are probably the same, and Wood and Bright (1992) listed the synonyms as above, choosing
Cryphalus dorsalis
as the valid name with
dorsalis
getting priority chosen by the first reviser. The nomenclature is being treated as valid, but the subjective synonymy is uncertain (see Mandelshtam and Nikitsky 2005 ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus confusus Eggers, 1927b: 395
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Cryphalus confusus Eggers, 1927b
, because the combination is already occupied following the transfer of
Margadillius confusus Hopkins, 1915
to
Cryphalus
. The replacement name is a noun in the genitive case, honoring the original author.

Remarks: The original and subsequent spelling is erraticum as an adjective, which should be the masculine
erraticus
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus cylindrus Browne, 1984d: 92
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Cryphalus cylindrus Browne, 1984d
following the transfer of
Dacryphalus cylindrus Browne, 1950
from
Hypocryphalus
. The replacement name is an adjective, meaning either brown or indistinct.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus laevis Browne, 1984b: 288
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Cryphalus laevis Browne, 1984b
because the name is occupied by
Hypocryphalus laevis Browne, 1980a
. The replacement name is an adjective meaning slender or graceful.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Cryphalus premayaensis Murayama, 1943: 97
(syn: Mandelshtam et al., 2007 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cryphalus luteus Johnson
nom. nov.
[
Margadillius
].

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Margadillius fulvus Browne, 1984b: 289
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Margadillius fulvus Browne, 1984b
after its transfer to
Cryphalus
, because the name is already occupied by
Cryphalus fulvus Niisima, 1908
. The name is an adjective, meaning either brown or yellow, maintaining the original meaning.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cryphalus mangiferae Stebbing, 1914: 542
comb. res. [
Hypocryphalus
] (nomen protectum).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cryphalus minusculus Johnson
nom. nov.
[
Hypocryphalus
].

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Hypocryphalus minutus Browne, 1980c: 495
syn. nov.
(secondary homonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A replacement name is proposed for
Hypocryphalus minutus Browne, 1980c
following its transfer to
Cryphalus
. The name is occupied by
Margadillius minutus Hopkins, 1915
. The replacement name is an adjective, and maintains the original meaning, referencing the very small size.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cryphalus mollis Schedl, 1955a: 288
comb. res. [
Hypocryphalus
].

=
Hypocryphalus tongaensis Schedl, 1979c: 104
(syn: Beaver, 1987 ).
Cryphalus montanus Nobuchi, 1964: 129
.
